rev.comment: Reverted [[WP:AGF|good faith]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/109.76.175.186|109.76.175.186]]; Non factual info: that is not an official variant. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
rev.diff:
Line 156: Line 156:
Official variants store packages and updates in the same [[Software repository|repositories]] as Ubuntu, so that the same software is available for each of them and is generally compatible between the official variants. The Ubuntu derivatives that are fully supported by Canonical are:<ref name="ubuntu_derivatives">{{cite web |url=http://www.ubuntu.com/products/whatisubuntu/derivatives |title=Derivatives |accessdate=2009-01-13}}</ref>
Official variants store packages and updates in the same [[Software repository|repositories]] as Ubuntu, so that the same software is available for each of them and is generally compatible between the official variants. The Ubuntu derivatives that are fully supported by Canonical are:<ref name="ubuntu_derivatives">{{cite web |url=http://www.ubuntu.com/products/whatisubuntu/derivatives |title=Derivatives |accessdate=2009-01-13}}</ref>
â
*[[Zorin OS]], a Ubuntu/Windows crossover
 
*[[Kubuntu]], a desktop distribution using [[KDE]] rather than [[GNOME]].
*[[Kubuntu]], a desktop distribution using [[KDE]] rather than [[GNOME]].
*[[Edubuntu]], a GNOME-based subproject and add-on for Ubuntu, designed for school environments and home users.<ref>{{cite web |title=Edubuntu - Frequently asked questions |url=http://www.edubuntu.org/faq |accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref>
*[[Edubuntu]], a GNOME-based subproject and add-on for Ubuntu, designed for school environments and home users.<ref>{{cite web |title=Edubuntu - Frequently asked questions |url=http://www.edubuntu.org/faq |accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref>
